meanings.definition: The quality or state of being like a mat.
meanings.sent1: The matiness of the carpet made it perfect for wiping our shoes.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the matiness of the welcome mat under my feet.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur had a certain matiness that made it look adorable.
meanings.sent4: The matiness of the forest floor reminded me of a cozy blanket.
meanings.sent5: The matiness of the doormat was so inviting, I couldn't resist wiping my feet on it.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of having a rough or coarse texture like a mat.
meanings.sent1: The matiness of the doormat scratched my bare feet.
meanings.sent2: I avoided the matiness of the rough carpet to protect my skin.
meanings.sent3: The matiness of the towel felt oddly comforting against my skin.
meanings.sent4: The matiness of the burlap sack reminded me of sandpaper.
meanings.sent5: The matiness of the welcome mat was so rough, it exfoliated my heels.

meanings.definition: The feeling of being tangled or matted, as hair or fibers.
meanings.sent1: The matiness of my hair after swimming was a nightmare to untangle.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the matiness of the yarn as I tried to unravel it.
meanings.sent3: The matiness of the rope made it impossible to use for climbing.
meanings.sent4: The matiness of the old carpet made it hard to vacuum properly.
meanings.sent5: The matiness of the fabric caused it to stick together and form knots.
